{{cpp/title|towupper}}
{{cpp/string/wide/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cwctype|
std::wint_t towupper( std::wint_t ch );
}}
Converts the given wide character to uppercase, if possible.

{{cpp/string/wide/wint_t args}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|wide character to be converted}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Uppercase version of {{c|ch}} or unmodified {{c|ch}} if no uppercase version is listed in the current C locale.

===Notes===
Only 1:1 character mapping can be performed by this function, e.g. the uppercase form of {{c/core|'ß'}} is (with some exceptions) the two-character string {{c/core|"SS"}}, which cannot be obtained by {{tt|std::towupper}}.

[https://www.open-std.org/JTC1/SC35/WG5/docs/30112d10.pdf ISO 30112] specifies which pairs of Unicode characters are included in this mapping.

===Example===
{{example
|The latin {{enwiki|Long s|letter 'ſ' (U+017F)}} is the alternative lowercase form of {{c/core|'S'}} (U+0053).
|code=
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;cwctype&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    wchar_t c = L'\u017f'; // Latin small letter Long S ('ſ')

    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::hex &lt;&lt; std::showbase;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "in the default locale, towupper("
              &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;std::wint_t&gt;(c) &lt;&lt; ") = "
              &lt;&lt; std::towupper(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_US.utf8");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "in Unicode locale, towupper("
              &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;std::wint_t&gt;(c) &lt;&lt; ") = "
              &lt;&lt; std::towupper(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
in the default locale, towupper(0x17f) = 0x17f
in Unicode locale, towupper(0x17f) = 0x53
}}
